name: decorate-files-and-folders
description: Decorate Files and FOlders with colors and badges

commands.title: Delete user-defined colors in all settings

decorateFiles.decorations.globalEnable.markdownDescription: Enable color and badge decorations on editor tabs and in the Explorer of specified files. The settings `#explorer.decorations.colors#` and `#explorer.decorations.badges#` must be set to `true` for each of the **Decorate Files** settings to take effect. Changing any of the `Decorate Files` settings requires a **reload** to take effect.
decorateFiles.decorations.globalEnable.title: Decorate Files: Decorations

decorateFiles.decorations.apply.markdownDescription: Apply color and badge decorations on editor tabs and in the Explorer to the specified resources. These decorations will be applied top-down in the order listed below, with earlier decorations having priority.
decorateFiles.decorations.apply.title: Decorate Files: Decorations

enableFilePaths.description: Decorate folders and fileNames containing some string.

enableMultirootWorkspaces.description: Decorate each folder of a multiroot workspace.

decorateFiles.filePaths.markdownDescription: Enter a portion of a path and a color value as a hex string like `#ab6009`. Example: `.js: #f00` to make all files ending with `.js` red.  `someFolder/: #f00` to make the folder name red. `someFolder/**: #f00` to make the folder name and its descendants red.

read-only files.description: Add a badge to read-only files.

non-workspace files.description: Add a badge to non-Workspace files

decorateFiles.badges.markdownDescription: Can be 1-2 characters, including unicode characters (but not unicode, don't use `\u23F9` for example, paste its character ⏹ instead). Leave the value empty for no badge.  The setting `#explorer.decorations.badges#` must be set to `true` for this setting to take effect.

colors.description: Color for a non-workspace editor label
Color for a non-workspace editor label
Color for a read-only editor label and Explorer fileName
